sentences.sContent: “We used to work and eat,” Ms. Devi said, her face etched by decades of blistering winters, her fingers thick from summers of tilling the soil.
sentences.sContent_eng: “We used to work and eat,” Ms. Devi said, her face etched by decades of blistering winters, her fingers thick from summers of tilling the soil.
sentences.sCn: 德薇的脸上蚀刻几十年冬天风霜，夏天的劳作使她的手变得又粗有厚，她说：“我们以前就是干活和吃饭。

sentences.sContent: Crosses were etched into the walls.
sentences.sCn: 十字架被凿刻在了墙上。

sentences.sContent: Windows are etched with the vehicle identification number.
sentences.sCn: 窗户被凿刻上了车辆识别号码。

trans.tranCn: [冶][印刷] 蚀刻（etch的过去分词）
trans.tranOther: If a line or pattern is etched into a surface, it is cut into the surface by means of acid or a sharp tool. You can also say that a surface is etched with a line or pattern.
